intro: Peixotoa irwinii, commonly known as the Irwin's peixotoa, is a species of flowering plant in the family Malvaceae. It is native to the Andean region of South America, specifically Ecuador and Peru. The plant is characterized by its distinctive yellow flowers and palmate leaves. It thrives in humid, high-altitude environments and is often found in cloud forests. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
